oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bovine Abortion Due to a Neospora-like Protozoan
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Nietfeld, Jerome
Yaeger, Michael
Dubey, J. P.
Anderson, Mark
Libal, Melissa
Neiger, Regg
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: protozoan
abortion
Neospora caninum
Neospora-like protozoan
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A protozoan closely related to Neospora caninum, which until more fully characterized is usually referred to as a Neospora-like protozoan, was recently demonstrated to be the most common cause of abortion in dairy breed bovine fetuses submitted to the South Dakota Animal Disease Research and Diagnostic Laboratory (SDADRDL).10 The purpose of this report is to briefly review Neospora-like protozoan as a cause of bovine abortion and to discuss the cases submitted to the SDADRDL.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1992: Volume 1; 61-66
